required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound Assessment of Gastric Emptying of Korean Meals: Rice and Noodle
clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasound Assessment of Gastric Emptying of Korean Meals in Healthy Volunteer: Rice and Noodle

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators evaluate gastric emptying time of common Korean meals (rice, noodles) in healthy volunteers.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators assess the gastric volume and contents of healthy volunteers at 4, 5, 6, 7, 8 hours after eating common Korean meal (rice or noodle) using a ultrasonography.

primary_outcome.description: The time for digesting a meal

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 4, 5, 6, 7, and 8 hours after eating a meal.
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of full stomach is assessed by using ultrasonography.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cross sectional area of the stomach
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 4, 5, 6, 7, and 8 hours after eating a meal.
secondary_outcome.description: The cross sectional area of the stomach is assessed by using ultrasonography in the supine and right lateral positions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 4, 5, 6, 7, and 8 hours after eating a meal.
secondary_outcome.description: The volume of stomach is assessed using the following formula; volume of stomach (mL) = 27.0 + 14.6 x cross-sectional area (right lateral position) - 1.28 x age.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 4, 5, 6, 7, and 8 hours after eating a meal.
secondary_outcome.description: The type of gastric contents is assessed using ultrasonography.

arm_group.description: Group that healthy volunteers eat rice.
Group that healthy volunteers eat noodle.

intervention.intervention_name: Evaluation of gastric volume and content
intervention.description: The gastric volume and gastric content are assessed at 4, 5, 6, 7, and 8 hours after eating a meal.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult healthy volunteers
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of gastrectomy
- Anatomical abnormalities or mass of stomach
